Legal & Regulatory Framework: Public Procurement Code aligned with WAEMU; oversight by ARMP, DNCMP, DDCMP, and ABREP.
Lead Procurement Institutions: Ministry of Health; CAME; SoBAPS S.A.
Estimation of Needs: Facility-level data through PNDS and LMIS; weak data systems and incomplete reporting.
Costing Process: Ministry-led with donor support; budget constraints hinder efficiency.
Supplier Selection: National prequalification with limited supplier pool; oversight by SoBAPS S.A. and ARMP.
Contract Negotiation: Managed by Ministry & CAME; slow finalization due to limited capacity.
Purchase Order Management: Manual systems with frequent errors and limited tracking.
Reception & Distribution: Managed by CAME; limited warehouse capacity and poor storage.
Payment Processing: Managed by Ministry of Finance; delays common due to donor-dependent disbursement.
Quality Assurance Mechanisms: Basic QA protocols supported by donors; oversight by ABREP.
Key Bottlenecks: Manual systems, limited supplier pool, poor tracking, limited storage capacity.

Estimation of Needs: Facility-level data with gaps; limited reporting capacity.
Costing Process: Ministry of Health & PCG SA; affected by price volatility.
Supplier Selection: PCG SA with donor support; QA challenges persist.

Purchase Order Management: Coordination challenges and delays at PCG SA.

Payment Processing: Managed by Ministry and PCG SA; currency risks cause delays.
Quality Assurance Mechanisms: QA through PCG SA and Ministry; WHO prequalification support.

Legal & Regulatory Framework: WAEMU-aligned procurement law under Public Procurement Act No. 2011-37 and Decree No. 2016-641; ARMP oversight.
Lead Procurement Institutions: Ministry of Health; ONPPC-EPIC; LANSPEX; SONIPHAR; DPHL/MT.
Estimation of Needs: Consumption-based forecasting with weak data integration and inconsistent reporting.
Costing Process: Limited financial planning tools within DPHL/MT and ONPPC.
Supplier Selection: Small supplier pool; donor support required; lengthy evaluations.
Contract Negotiation: Delays due to legal complexity and limited negotiation capacity.
Reception & Distribution: Weak inspection protocols; limited storage capacity.
Payment Processing: Delays caused by weak controls; bureaucratic issues and currency risks.
Key Bottlenecks: Legal delays; weak logistics; substandard deliveries.
Successful Practices: Regional coordination improvements and donor-supported QA.

Legal & Regulatory Framework: National procurement law (Decree No. 2002-08 & Law No. 2010-044); oversight by ARMP and CPB.
Estimation of Needs: Fragmented data systems; limited digital tools; estimation by PNLS, PNLP, NTP.
Costing Process: Costing affected by donor dependence and exchange rate risks.
Supplier Selection: Weak local supplier base; risk of counterfeit medicines; bureaucratic delays.
Contract Negotiation: Weak negotiation capacity and complex legal clauses.
Purchase Order Management: Manual PO verification; requires approval from Ministry of Health.
Reception & Distribution: Inadequate storage managed by Central Medical Stores; distribution delays.
Payment Processing: Ministry of Finance; delays from donor procedures and internal reviews.
Quality Assurance Mechanisms: Weak QA enforcement; limited capacity at CPB.
Key Bottlenecks: Donor dependency; fragmented systems; corruption risks.
